summary: Operations and program manager with 20+ years of military aviation and logistics leadership and 2+ years in supply chain systems. Skilled in program management, ERP/WMS/TMS integrations, Lean Six Sigma process improvement, and risk management.
eligibilities: Veterans Employment Opportunities Act (VEOA) – Status Candidate (Merit Promotion)

work.title: Supply Chain Systems & Operations Manager
work.duties: Direct multi-site logistics, manufacturing, and capital projects supporting asphalt production. Lead ERP, WMS, and TMS integrations to improve throughput, DIFOT, and cost efficiency. Oversee 3PL performance, compliance, safety, and predictive analytics programs. Supervise civilian staff and contractors to deliver cross-functional projects, ensuring compliance with policy and budget execution requirements.
highlights: Improved DIFOT by 15% and delivery quality by 18% through GPS fleet tracking and supplier dashboards.
Delivered $2.3M in cost savings and achieved >99.5% inventory accuracy via ERP/WMS integration and 3PL optimization.
Increased throughput by 12% while sustaining zero OSHA recordables.
Led continuity planning and risk management initiatives to ensure supply chain resilience.
Directed mission support operations across logistics and systems.
Managed stakeholder engagement, contractor coordination, and cross-functional project delivery.

work.title: Program Manager – Aviation & Logistics
work.supervisor: Supervisors (last 5 years) include Scott G. Ciluffo (DAC, USAACE), Donald R. Kirk (LTC), Ty L. Powell (GS-14).
work.duties: Directed aviation and logistics programs across 20+ years, including combat deployments, global logistics networks, and senior-level training management. Managed Commander’s Aircrew Training Program at USAACE, supporting Commanding General and senior staff missions. Oversaw multimillion-dollar aviation supply chains, 3PL contracts, and readiness portfolios worth $48M+. Led curriculum development and training for 400+ warrant officers at Aviation Warrant Officer Basic Course. Executed precision aviation support for Special Operations Forces, Congress, and VIP missions with zero safety incidents. Supervised military and civilian personnel; developed and implemented policy, strategic plans, and budget execution processes across aviation and logistics programs.
highlights: Rated top 5% of CW3s by senior rater; recognized as Honor Graduate, WOAC (2015).
Sustained >98% operational readiness during 200+ global missions while managing multimillion-dollar budgets.
Led training and curriculum development for 400+ warrant officers; improved graduation and readiness outcomes.
Executed strategic and operational risk management, ensuring zero safety incidents in combat and peacetime missions.
Directed budget formulation and execution for multimillion-dollar programs.
Supervised and mentored staff, aligning mission support with federal policies and human capital requirements.

FAA Flight Instructor CFI/CFII; Remote Pilot (Part 107)
